message:
{
    "name": "Robinson-Trautman metric in the presence of a null shell",
    "abbrev": "RobTrauMetric",
    "description": "The Robinson-Trautman metric is a solution to Einstein's field equations that describes the spacetime around a null shell, which is a surface that is null and has a constant energy density. It is a four-dimensional spacetime that is asymptotically flat and has a singularity at the center.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": false,
    "signature": -1,
    "dimensions": 4,
    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "Spherical",
            "xlineElement": "ds² = (1 - 2m/r) dt² + 1/r² (dr² + dθ²) + r² dφ²",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": ["christoffels", "ricci", "riemann", "einstein", "weyl", "g00", "infiniteRedShift", "horizons", "singularities", "limits"]
}[0m
